intro: Romulea alticola, commonly known as the Alpine romulea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related plants. The plant produces striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Romulea alticola is often found in grasslands and open slopes, where it blooms during the summer months.
